title: üé≠ Roleplay - Customer Service Simulation
lead: Practice your service skills! You are the SAC attendant and must choose the best responses.

result.title: Congratulations!
result.great: Very good! You're on the right track!
result.good: Good, but you can improve. Review the content!
result.needs_work: Needs more study. Review the course modules!

steps.name: Introduction
steps.clientSays: Hello, good afternoon! I bought this blender here yesterday and would like to exchange it for another model.

options.text: Good afternoon! Of course, I can help you with that. Does the product have any defect or problem?
options.feedback: Excellent! You greeted the customer cordially and already asked an important question to understand the situation.

options.text: Unfortunately, it's not possible to exchange products that have already been purchased and taken home.
options.feedback: This response is too negative and doesn't welcome the customer. We should always understand the situation first before denying anything.

options.text: You can leave the product on the counter and someone will check it for you later.
options.feedback: This response is too informal and doesn't show interest in helping the customer. Service should always be cordial and professional.

steps.name: Customer Question
steps.clientSays: No, it's not defective. I just saw another model that appealed to me more. I read online that I have the right to exchange within 7 days, right?

options.text: Yes, absolutely! You have this right guaranteed by law. Let's do the exchange now.
options.feedback: Be careful! The 7-day right of withdrawal only applies to ONLINE purchases. In physical stores, exchange is a commercial policy, not a legal right.

options.text: The 7-day right applies to online purchases. In physical stores it's a courtesy. I can check our policy!
options.feedback: Perfect! You correctly explained the difference between the legal right (online purchases) and commercial policy (physical store), without denying help to the customer.

options.text: That 7-day rule is only for online purchases, so it doesn't apply here. Sorry.
options.feedback: Although the information about online is correct, the response is too negative. We should always seek alternatives to help the customer.

steps.name: Additional Question
steps.clientSays: Oh, I see... so you won't exchange? And if the product has a defect later, can I complain?

options.text: Yes, you can! For defects you have 90 days. And our policy allows exchange within 30 days with receipt!
options.feedback: Excellent! You correctly informed the 90-day period for defect claims on durable goods AND also offered the exchange possibility through the company's policy.

options.text: For defects you can complain, but the deadline is only 7 days after purchase.
options.feedback: Incorrect! The period to claim defects on durable goods is 90 DAYS, not 7 days.

options.text: If the product doesn't have a defect now, we can't do anything later, unfortunately.
options.feedback: Incorrect! Hidden defects (defects that appear later) can be claimed up to 90 days for durable goods.

steps.name: Closing
steps.clientSays: Great! So I can exchange for the other model? The product is still sealed and I have the receipt.

options.text: I can't do the exchange because, as I explained, it's not a legal obligation of the store.
options.feedback: Inappropriate response. The customer meets the requirements of the commercial policy (sealed product + receipt).

options.text: With a sealed product and receipt, I can do the exchange! Which model do you prefer?
options.feedback: Congratulations! You finished the service positively, confirming that the customer meets the requirements and proceeding with the exchange.

options.text: I need to call my manager to authorize this type of exchange procedure here.
options.feedback: Unnecessary in this case. Since the customer meets the policy requirements (sealed + receipt), you can resolve it without escalating.
